intro: Bothriocline glabrescens, commonly known as the silky everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are often clustered in a single head, giving it a delicate appearance. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, contributing to its common name. Bothriocline glabrescens is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
